briefTitle: Does Intra-operative MarginProbe Use Reduce Re-excision Rates?
officialTitle: Reducing Re-excisions After Breast Conserving Surgery: A Randomized Controlled Trial Comparing the MarginProbe Device in Addition to Standard Operating Procedure Versus Standard Operating Procedure Alone in Preventing Re-excision
primaryOutcomeMeasure: To determine if intraoperative margin assessment after excision of a cancer reduces second operations (reexcision or mastectomy), compared to standard surgical practice by 9 months after primary surgery.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria;

* Women aged 18-90 years with DCIS or Invasive Breast cancer containing DCIS diagnosed histopathologically.
* Histologically diagnosed DCIS or invasive lobular cancer in core biopsy (B5a or B5b).
* Tumour size 1.5cm - 4cm and undergoing breast cancer surgery. Written informed consent.

Exclusion Criteria;

* Unsuitable for BCS on basis of tumour size (\<1.5cm or \>4cm) or stage.
* Radiotherapy contraindicated.
* No histopathological evidence of DCIS or invasive lobular cancer.
* Neoadjuvant chemotherapy.
